comments:
When a decorator throws an exception it seems that all views showing the
decoration become corrupt. It would be better if the decorator manager would
try/catch runtime exceptions and simply log the error and continue. Thus not
corrupting the view being decorated and allowing it to still be useable.

From Bug 41292:

Using Eclipse 3.0 M2 and the VSS plug-in
(http://sourceforge.net/projects/vssplugin).  The VSS plug-in works with 2.1 but
apparently has problems with 3.0.  If the VSS plug-in decorators are on, error
message boxes pop up, none of the views that use VSS decorators display items
properly (you get the shape of the tree with no icons or text), and the
following is displayed in the .log file:
